summary: genome ANNOUNCEMENT Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PEDV) is an enveloped virus with a single-stranded, positive-sense RNA. it causes porcine epidemic diarrhea, an enteric disease characterized by acute watery diarrhea, dehydration, vomiting, and high mortality in nursery piglets. a PEDV variant has been identified as a main causative agent in the disease (4–7). the genome sequence of JS2008 is similar to that of other reported PEDV genomes. the gene order 5′-ORF1a/1b-S-ORF3-E-M-N-3′ is 20,321 nt in length.
